title: Scripters in d5 and high plat rank games
body:
I don't know man. This elo is so much different from few months ago. There are a group of people that have terrible game sense with sick 'mechanics', like clicking the mouse and changing face direction 10 times in 1 second. They usually pick high damage champions like vayne, viktor and such. They do not care about positioning and just always stay at front mostly, but dodge most of the skillshots and then die to something like master yi who just walk up....

Does anyone else have similar experience to this topic? Perhaps just me being unlucky zzz.....

replies.body: Riot hasn't given a single fk about anything since launch, as long as nerds and kids are buying skins then they will continue to give 0 fks about the problems of the game.

There's scripters in challenger you think Riot gives a shit? This happens in all regions, they have been playing all year with no bans, suspensions or even warnings, Riot doesn't give a single fuck all they care about is their paycheck.

Why rush occult? wouldnt tiamat / hydra rush be better? :o
Because Occult is fun and i am an experienced Rengar that will get stacks on it, Occult is more worth if you can get stacks, you only need seven stacks for Occult to be worth it.
Ohhh okay thanks, would you recommend it for top lane Rengar as well or only jungle?
Both, but if you cant get stacks on the item then you really shouldn't be getting it.
i can confirm that riot does not in fact give any shits regarding anything that wont help them benefit financially, as many people have already noticed

The worst is when you suspect someone is a scripter, you can't be certain and you're team doesn't believe you. You feel like you're slowly going crazy. 

The whole experience made me understand how fearing the bogeyman or ghosts must feel.

Oh my god I go crazy when I run into this. I play Thresh and sometimes I see Yasuo's consistently windwalling my hooks from pink warded bushes, and absolute god mechanic players dodging 2 -3 skill shots at once, but then dying because they are way overextended.
